description: UPDATED: Drop-in Monday - Friday only. (not open weekends). Learn about the built environment of the City of London. See the interactive 1:500 scale Pipers model of the City with the latest developments and architecture.

factsheet.heading: The Square Mile's Built Environment
paragraphs: The City Centre is a space to come to learn about and debate the built environment of the Square Mile and is home to the City of Londonâ€™s official architectural model. Through exhibitions, events and learning activity, The City Centre provides access to the City for professionals, the public and young people, helping to inform good decision-making and inspiring young people to engage with the built environment. It is managed by New London Architecture on behalf of the City of London Corporation.

factsheet.heading: Pipers' City of London Model
paragraphs: The City Centre houses a unique interactive decision-making tool, which is often used as the focal point of presentations. The 1:500 scale model of the City offers an essential guide to property in the Square Mile and provides an overview of the entire area. Each property is shown in the context of neighbouring occupants, nearby facilities and public transport. The City London model is a fascinating depiction of a 21st century city built on 2,000 years of history.

factsheet.heading: VU.CITY
paragraphs: VU.CITY is an interactive smart screen which allows users to instantly test ideas and visualise developments in an accurate context. Architects, developers, students and the public have the ability to map out and visualise future architectural plans with ease in an up-to-date map of London.
